title: Wi-Fi (com.apple.wifi.managed)
description: The payload that configures Wi-Fi settings.

IsHotspot.title: Is Hotspot
IsHotspot.description: If 'true', the device treats the network as a hotspot.

SSID_STR.title: Service Set Identifier (SSID)
SSID_STR.description: The SSID of the Wi-Fi network to use. In iOS 7.0 and later, the SSID is optional if a value exists for 'DomainName' value.

HIDDEN_NETWORK.title: Hidden Network
HIDDEN_NETWORK.description: If 'true', defines this network as hidden.

AutoJoin.title: Auto Join
AutoJoin.description:
If 'true', the device joins the network automatically.

If 'false', the user must tap the network name to join it.

CaptiveBypass.title: Disable Captive Network Detection
CaptiveBypass.description: If 'true', the system bypasses Captive Network detection when the device connects to the network.

DisableAssociationMACRandomization.title: Disable MAC address randomization during association
DisableAssociationMACRandomization.description:
If 'true,' disables MAC address randomization for a Wi-Fi network while associated with that network. This feature also shows a privacy warning in Settings indicating that the network has reduced privacy protections.

If 'false', then the system enables MAC address randomization on iOS, watchOS, and visionOS.

This value is only locked when MDM installs the profile. If the profile is manually installed, the system sets the value but the user can change it.

EnableIPv6.title: Enable IPv6
EnableIPv6.description: If 'true', enables IPv6 on this interface.

ProxyType.title: Proxy Type
ProxyType.description: The proxy type, if any, to use. If you choose the manual proxy type, you need the proxy server address, including its port and optionally a user name and password into the proxy server. If you choose the auto proxy type, you can enter a proxy autoconfiguration (PAC) URL.

ProxyUsername.title: Proxy Username
ProxyUsername.description: The user name used to authenticate to the proxy server.

ProxyPassword.title: Proxy Password
ProxyPassword.description: The password used to authenticate to the proxy server.

ProxyPACURL.title: Proxy PAC URL
ProxyPACURL.description: The URL of the PAC file that defines the proxy configuration.

ProxyPACFallbackAllowed.title: Proxy PAC Fallback Allowed
ProxyPACFallbackAllowed.description: If 'true', allows connecting directly to the destination if the PAC file is unreachable.

EncryptionType.title: Encryption Type
EncryptionType.description:
The encryption type for the network.

If set to anything except 'None', the payload may contain the following three keys: 'Password', 'PayloadCertificateUUID', or 'EAPClientConfiguration'.

As of iOS 16, tvOS 16, watchOS 9, and macOS 13:

- 'WPA' allows joining WPA or WPA2 networks
- 'WPA2' allows joining WPA2 or WPA3 networks
- 'WPA3' allows joining WPA3 networks only
- 'Any' allows joining WPA, WPA2, WPA3, and WEP networks

Prior to iOS 16, tvOS 16, and watchOS 9, specifying 'WPA', 'WPA2', and 'WPA3' were equivalent and would allow joining any WPA network.

Prior to macOS 13, the encryption type, if specified explicitly, needed to match the encryption type of the network exactly.

Password.title: Password
Password.description: The password for the access point.

DisplayedOperatorName.title: Displayed Operator Name
DisplayedOperatorName.description: The operator name to display when connected to this network. Used only with Wi-Fi Hotspot 2.0 access points.

DomainName.title: Domain Name
DomainName.description: The primary domain of the tunnel.

ServiceProviderRoamingEnabled.title: Roaming Enable
ServiceProviderRoamingEnabled.description: If 'true', allows connection to roaming service providers.

RoamingConsortiumOIs.title: Roaming OIs
RoamingConsortiumOIs.description: An array of Roaming Consortium Organization Identifiers used for Wi-Fi Hotspot 2.0 negotiation.

NAIRealmNames.title: Realm Names
NAIRealmNames.description: An array of Network Access Identifier Realm names used for Wi-Fi Hotspot 2.0 negotiation.

MCCAndMNCs.title: MCC/MNCs
MCCAndMNCs.description: An array of Mobile Country Code/Mobile Network Code (MCC/MNC) pairs used for Wi-Fi Hotspot 2.0 negotiation. Each string must contain exactly six digits.

HESSID.title: Homogenous Extended Service Set Identifier (HESSID)
HESSID.description: The HESSID used for Wi-Fi Hotspot 2.0 negotiation.

SetupModes.title: EAP Setup Modes
SetupModes.description: An array of strings that contain the type of connection mode to attach.

items.title: EAP Type
items.description: An integer representing an EAP type, inside of the Accept EAP Types array.

AcceptEAPTypes.title: Accept EAP Types
AcceptEAPTypes.description:
The EAP types that the system accepts. Allowed values:

- '13': EAP-TLS
- '17': LEAP
- '18': EAP-SIM
- '21': EAP-TTLS
- '23': EAP-AKA
- '25': PEAPv0/v1
- '43': EAP-FAST

For EAP-TLS authentication without a network payload, install the necessary identity certificates and have your users select EAP-TLS mode in the 802.1X credentials dialog that appears when they connect to the network. For other EAP types, a network payload is necessary and must specify the correct settings for the network.

UserName.title: Username
UserName.description: The user name for the account. If you don't specify a value, the system prompts the user during login.

UserPassword.title: Password
UserPassword.description: The user's password. If you don't specify a value, the system prompts the user during login.

OneTimeUserPassword.title: Per-Connection Password
OneTimeUserPassword.description: If 'true', the user receives a prompt for a password each time they connect to the network.

items.title: Individual Certificate Anchor UUID
items.description: A UUID for a trusted certificate

PayloadCertificateAnchorUUID.title: Certificate Anchor UUID
PayloadCertificateAnchorUUID.description: An array of the UUID of each certificate payload in the same profile to trust for authentication. Use this key to prevent the device from asking the user whether to trust the listed certificates. Dynamic trust (the certificate dialogue) is in a disabled state if you specify this property without also enabling 'TLSAllowTrustExceptions'.

items.title: Individual Trusted TLS Server Name
items.description: An item in the TLS Trusted Server Names array representing a Common Name of a server certificate.

TLSTrustedServerNames.title: TLS Trusted Server Names
TLSTrustedServerNames.description:
The list of accepted server certificate common names. If a server presents a certificate that isn't in this list, the system doesn't trust it.
If you specify this property, the system disables dynamic trust (the certificate dialog) unless you also specify 'TLSAllowTrustExceptions' with the value 'true'.
If necessary, use wildcards to specify the name, such as 'wpa.*.example.com'.

TLSAllowTrustExceptions.title: Allow Trust Exceptions
TLSAllowTrustExceptions.description:
If 'true', allows a dynamic trust decision by the user. The dynamic trust is the certificate dialogue that appears when the system doesn't trust a certificate.
If 'false', the authentication fails if the system doesn't already trust the certificate.
As of iOS 8, Apple no longer supports this key.

TTLSInnerAuthentication.title: TTLS Inner Authentication
TTLSInnerAuthentication.description: The inner authentication that the TTLS module uses.

OuterIdentity.title: Outer Identity
OuterIdentity.description:
A name that hides the user's true name. The user's actual name appears only inside the encrypted tunnel. For example, you might set this to anonymous or anon, or anon@mycompany.net. It can increase security because an attacker can't see the authenticating user's name in the clear.
This key is only relevant to TTLS, PEAP, and EAP-FAST.
This field is required if 'TLSMinimumVersion' is '1.3'.

TLSMinimumVersion.title: TLS Minimum Version
TLSMinimumVersion.description: The minimum TLS version for EAP authentication.

TLSMaximumVersion.title: TLS Maximum Version
TLSMaximumVersion.description: The maximum TLS version for EAP authentication.

EAPFASTUsePAC.title: Use PAC
EAPFASTUsePAC.description: If 'true', the device uses an existing PAC if it's present. Otherwise, the server must present its identity using a certificate.

EAPFASTProvisionPAC.title: Provision PAC
EAPFASTProvisionPAC.description:
If 'true', allows PAC provisioning.

This value is only applicable if 'EAPFASTUsePAC' is 'true'. This value must be 'true' for EAP-FAST PAC usage to succeed because there's no other way to provision a PAC.

EAPFASTProvisionPACAnonymously.title: Provision PAC Anonymously
EAPFASTProvisionPACAnonymously.description: If 'true', provisions the device anonymously. Note that there are known machine-in-the-middle attacks for anonymous provisioning.

EAPSIMNumberOfRANDs.title: Allow Two RANDs
EAPSIMNumberOfRANDs.description:
The minimum number of RAND values to accept from the server.
For use with EAP-SIM only.

SystemModeCredentialsSource.title: System Profile Credentials Source
SystemModeCredentialsSource.description:
Set this string to 'ActiveDirectory' to use the AD computer name and password credentials.
If using this property, you can't use 'SystemModeUseOpenDirectoryCredentials'.

SystemModeUseOpenDirectoryCredentials.title: Use OpenDirectory System Profile Credentials
SystemModeUseOpenDirectoryCredentials.description:
If 'true', the system mode connection tries to use the Open Directory credentials.
If using this property, you can't use 'SystemModeCredentialsSource'.

TLSTrustedCertificates.title: TLS Trusted Certificates
TLSTrustedCertificates.description: An array of trusted certificates. Each entry in the array must contain certificate data that represents an anchor certificate used for verifying the server certificate.

TLSCertificateIsRequired.description:
If 'true', allows for two-factor authentication for EAP-TTLS, PEAP, or EAP-FAST. If 'false', allows for zero-factor authentication for EAP-TLS.
If you don't specify a value, the default is 'true' for EAP-TLS, and 'false' for other EAP types.

QoSMarkingPolicy.title: QoS Marking Policy
QoSMarkingPolicy.description: A dictionary that contains the list of apps that the system allows to benefit from L2 and L3 marking. When this dictionary isn't present, the system allows all apps to use L2 and L3 marking when the Wi-Fi network supports Cisco QoS fast lane.

QoSMarkingEnabled.title: Allow QoS marking
QoSMarkingEnabled.description:
If 'true', disables L3 marking and only uses L2 marking for traffic that goes to the Wi-Fi network.



If 'false', the system behaves as if Wi-Fi doesn't have an association with a Cisco QoS fast lane network.

QoSMarkingAppleAudioVideoCalls.title: QoS marking for audio or video calls
QoSMarkingAppleAudioVideoCalls.description: If 'true', adds audio and video traffic of built-in audio or video services, such as FaceTime and Wi-Fi Calling, to the allow list for L2 and L3 marking for traffic that goes to the Wi-Fi network.

QoSMarkingAllowListAppIdentifiers.title: Allowlisted App Identifiers
QoSMarkingAllowListAppIdentifiers.description: An array of app bundle identifiers that defines the allow list for L2 and L3 marking for traffic that goes to the Wi-Fi network. If the array isn't present, but the 'QoSMarkingPolicy' key is present — even empty — no apps can use L2 and L3 marking.

PayloadCertificateUUID.title: Certificate UUID
PayloadCertificateUUID.description: The UUID of the certificate payload within the same profile to use for the client credential.

TLSCertificateRequired.title: Certificate Required
TLSCertificateRequired.description: If 'true', allows for two-factor authentication for EAP-TTLS, PEAP, or EAP-FAST. If 'false', allows for zero-factor authentication for EAP-TLS.
